titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Maud Ballington Booth Letter to Alice Boughton, 1905 January 27 RL.11629
titlestmt.author: Alice Poffinberger

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-06-14 13:38:37 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Maud Ballington Booth letter to Alice Boughton
did.abstract: Maud Ballington Booth was the founder, with her husband, of the Volunteers of America in 1896 and its auxiliary, the Volunteer Prison League. Collection comprises a typescript letter, signed Maud B. Booth, written to Alice Boughton on 1905 January 27, regarding a photographic portrait to be completed by Boughton.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Maud Ballington Booth was the founder, with her husband, of the Volunteers of America in 1896 and its auxiliary, the Volunteer Prison League.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Maud Ballington Booth Letter to Alice Boughton was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2015.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Maud Ballington Booth Letter to Alice Boughton, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2015-0050-LUBMSS129

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises a typescript letter, signed Maud B. Booth, written to Alice Boughton on 1905 January 27, regarding a photographic portrait to be completed by Boughton. On Prison League, Volunteers of America, stationary.
